entries.title: World Cup has 'changed the perception of this part of the world', says Qatar 2022 boss
entries.description: Qatar World Cup chief Hassan Al Thawadi says the tournament has changed perceptions of the region and transformed his country.

entries.title: Tourist family describe running down streets in Peru to stay safe amid anti-government protests
entries.description: A family of tourists stranded in the Peruvian city of Cusco amid anti-government protests have described "people walking around with baseball bats and breaking down doors".

entries.title: While Qataris may view the World Cup as a job well done, it remains that more change is needed
entries.description: It was one evening in Souq Waqif, a few days before the World Cup kicked off, when we first wondered whether things were quite how they seemed.

entries.title: Actress in Oscar-winning Iranian film arrested for 'spreading falsehoods'
entries.description: One of Iran's most famous actresses has been arrested and accused of "spreading falsehoods", state media has said.

entries.title: Croatia finish third after beating Morocco 2-1
entries.description: Croatia have finished third in the World Cup after beating Morocco in the third-fourth place play-off in Qatar.

entries.title: Former Nazi concentration camp secretary, 97, convicted of aiding more than 10,000 murders
entries.description: A 97-year-old former secretary to the SS commander of Nazi Germany's Stutthof concentration camp has been found guilty of being an accessory to 10,505 murders.

entries.title: Explosion at Polish police headquarters 'caused by grenade launcher from Ukraine'
entries.description: An explosion at the office of Poland's police chief was caused by a grenade launcher - a weapon that had been a gift from Ukraine, he says.

entries.title: Goalkeeper hit in face with metal bin as Australian fans storm pitch
entries.description: An Australian football match had to be abandoned after fans invaded the pitch and a goalkeeper was hit in the face with a metal bin.

entries.title: Varadkar returns as Irish PM - and he has much in common with Sunak
entries.description: Leo Varadkar has returned to the office of Taoiseach (Irish Prime Minister) in keeping with the agreement underpinning coalition government.

entries.title: Man avoids jail after stabbing nursery's pet tortoise in drunken attack
entries.description: A man has avoided jail after drunkenly attacking a pet tortoise at a nursery in California.

entries.title: FIFA disbanded human rights board and did not replace it with independent advisers
entries.description: FIFA disbanded its human rights board two years ago and did not act on a plea to urgently replace it with new independent advisers particularly providing scrutiny of the Qatar World Cup, Sky News can reveal.
